title: Korean Bibimbap with Beef and Bean Sprouts
description: A simplified Korean rice bowl with seasoned ground beef and crisp bean sprouts. Serve gochujang on the side for adjustable spice.

For Serving.notes: Korean chili paste, on the side

Cook Rice.text: Prepare the white rice according to package directions. Keep warm.

Marinate & Cook Beef.text: Combine ground beef, 2 tbsp soy sauce, 1 tbsp sesame oil, 1 tbsp minced garlic, sugar/honey, and pepper. Mix well.
Heat a tablespoon of oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
Add marinated beef, break it up, cook until browned. Set aside.

Prepare Bean Sprouts.text: Blanch bean sprouts in boiling water for 1-2 minutes until slightly tender but still crisp. Drain well.
Toss with 1 tsp soy sauce, 1 tsp sesame oil, 1/2 tsp minced garlic (optional), and a pinch of salt.

Fry Eggs.text: In a lightly oiled non-stick pan, fry eggs sunny-side up or over easy, leaving yolks runny.

Assemble Bowls.text: Arrange portions of cooked beef and bean sprouts over the rice.
Top each bowl with a fried egg.

Serve.text: Serve immediately. Provide gochujang and extra sesame oil on the side.

notes: Mix everything together in the bowl before eating.
Adjust gochujang amount to your spice preference.
storage: Store components separately in airtight containers in the fridge for 1-2 days.
Reheat gently (microwave or pan) and fry a fresh egg before serving.
